item.title: Nikki add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Carson McCullers
item.description: "Maybe when people longed for a thing that bad the longing made them trust in anything that might give it to them." -- Carson McCullers

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Do I contradict myself? Very well, then, I contradict myself; I am large -- I contain multitudes." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I sound my barbaric yawp over the rooftops of the world." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "The body apologizes to the soul for its errors, and the soul asks forgiveness for squatting in the body without invitation." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Nikki add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life isn't fair, it's just fairer than death, that's all." -- William Goldman

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I will describe my eyes and then begin the story. My eyes are blue and resplendent. Now I will begin the story." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Grandfather informs me that is not possible." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Life is a disease: sexually transmitted, and invariably fatal." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "The time has come," the walrus said, "to talk of many things: Of shoes and ships - and sealing wax - of cabbages and kings" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "He has robbed me, yet he has given me something of greater value . . . he has given to me myself." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers." -- Voltaire

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "I like being myself. Myself and nasty." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We accept the love we think we deserve." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Hubert Selby Jr.
item.description: "...and the night was comfortably warm as the soft filtered light continued to push the darkness into the shadows as they held each other and kissed and pushed each others darkness into the corner, believing in each others light, each others dream." -- Hubert Selby Jr.

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "You cannot find peace by avoiding life." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "The truth is, I often like women. I like their unconventionality. I like their completeness. I like their anonymity. " -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Live to the point of tears." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Do not wait for the last judgment. It comes every day." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Nikki add a quote by John Kennedy Toole
item.description: "I am at the moment writing a lengthy indictment against our century. When my brain begins to reel from my literary labors, I make an occasional cheese dip." -- John Kennedy Toole

item.title: Nikki add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "If I had my way we'd sleep every night all wrapped around each other like hibernating rattlesnakes." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Nikki add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. A psychotic is a guy who's just found out what's going on." -- William S. Burroughs
